newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan overseas assets to keep rising -- Sakakibara.
newsitem.headline: Japan overseas assets to keep rising -- Sakakibara.

text.p: Japan's external net assets are likely to continue to rise for some time, senior Ministry of Finance official Eisuke Sakakibara said on Thursday.
Sakakibara, director-general of the ministry's International Finance Bureau, made the comment to a parliamentary finance committee.
"Although our current account balance is on a declining trend, we have been maintaining a surplus. Our external net assets will likely continue to rise for some time," Sakakibara said.
Looking 10 to 20 years ahead, the current account balance may go into deficit, but there is unlikely to be a drastic drop in outstanding external assets, he said.

He also said the balance in merchandise and services trade accounts for only a small part of Japan's overall current account balance, and that most of the surplus came from the balance of income from overseas investment.
